p: A series of experiments was conducted to assess the level of toxicity of the SoEO on the seed germination, hypocotyl and root lengths and fresh weights of T. aestivum, R. sativus, S. lycopersicum and T. foenum-graecum (Figure 2 (Fig. 2) and 3 (Fig. 3)). The SoEO affected the germination and the seedling growth of tested seeds in a different way. Although the level of the major compounds in the essential oil of S. officinalis was closed to those of other Salvia species, the interaction between seed species and treatments (with or without SoEO) was statistically significant (P < 0.01). The SoEO did not statistically inhibit the germination of all tested seeds (Figure 2 (Fig. 2)).
